result.execSummary:
The defendant Reba L. Matelski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain GFE in FTE, schooling or combination of the two.
Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Complete any assessment, treatment, counseling deemed necessary by agent.  Complete AODA and follow through unless programming previously completed at NCHC is sufficient.   DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain GFE in fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the two.
Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol.
Complete any assessment, treatment, or counseling deemed necessary by agent. AODA w/ follow up.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Reba L. Matelski

records.descr: Amended Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt: Letter from DOC requesting court review additional sentence credit. Approved- 141 days credit granted.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Kimberly
Case called: 1:30pm
INCLUDES 15CF862, 15CF863, 15CF1015
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Defendant appears in person, in custody, with Atty Pauline Toulouse.
Date and time set for sentencing after revocation in 15CF1015 & reviews in 15CF862 & 15CF863

State says here for revoking ONLY 15CF1015 Ct. 1 due to Administrative Law Judge, Jason Grace, ordered that deft probation in 15CF862 and 15CF863 not be revoked on 10/18/16
Parties make arguments on recommendation for sentencing on 15CF1015
COURT makes findings
COURT ORDERS: 15CF1015 Ct. 1 (Bail Jumping-Felony): 6 years WSPS, 3 years IC, 3 years ES. Granted 138 days credit. CONDITTIONS of ES: Complete any assessment, treatment, or counseling deemed necessary by agent. Maintain GFE in full time employment/schooling/combination of the two. Complete AODA with follow through. Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol. Pay CC. Pay DNA sample and surcharge. Deft is eligible for both prison programming- Substance Abuse & Challenge Incarceration. 

Deft is remanded to MC Sheriff's Dept to be transported to prison.
Adj: 1:53pm
Sentencing hearing on revocation on December 7, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on December 1, 2016 at 09:15 am.
from Employer re: defendant and her employment

Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 1:47pm
INCLUDES 15CF862, 15CF863, 15CF874, 15CF1015, and 15CM1848
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo.  Deft appears in person, in custody, with Atty Thomas Roley

Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW.
State moves to:
15CF862: 
Ct. 2 Possess Drug Paraphernalia >> D&RI
Ct. 3 Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription >> D&RI
15CF863:
Ct. 2 Possession of Methamphetamine >> D&RI
Ct. 3 Maintain Drug Trafficking Place >> D&RI
Ct. 4 Possession of THC >> D&RI
15CF874:
Ct. 1 Bail Jumping - Felony >> D&RI
Ct. 2 Possess Drug Paraphernalia >> D&RI
15CF1015:
Ct. 2 Bail Jumping - Felony >> D&RI
Ct. 3 Bail Jumping - Felony >> D&RI
Ct. 4 Bail Jumping - Misdemanor >> D&RI
15CM1848:
Ct. 1 Possess Drug Paraphernalia >> D&RI
COURT grants above

PLEA: 
15CF862: 
Ct. 1 Possession of Methamphetamine >> NO CONTEST
15CF863:
Ct. 1 Possess w/Intent-Heroin (<=3g) >> NO CONTEST
15CF1015:
Ct. 1 Bail Jumping - Felony >> NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: w/ hold sentencing. 4 years probation, concurrent.
CONDITIONS: Complete any assessment, treatment, or counseling deemed necessary by agent. Maintain GFE in full time employment/schooling/combination of the two. Complete AODA with follow through, unless programming previously completed at NCHC is sufficient. Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol. Pay CC. Pay DNA sample and surcharge. 

Atty Roley to provide jail credit form to court

Adj: 2:09am

Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 for drugs-day reporting. Absolute sobriety from controlled substances. No controlled substances w/o a valid prescription and only in amount prescribed.

Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 10:02 am 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty Tom Roley. 
Waiver of Prelim. filed. 
Court questions deft as to waiver. 
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made. 
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial. 
Information filed. Reading Waived.
Plea: Not Guilty. 
Dates set: PTC set for 12/2/2015 at 10:15 am with Br. 1 JA. 
Atty Roley requests bond modification to allow deft to go into treatment facility on 11/16/2015. 
State has no objection to bond modification if condition is deft goes treatment facility. 
COURT modifies bond to $500 cash provided deft is accepted to go into treatment facility. 
Adj: 10:05 am 

C: Br. 1.

Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 for drugs-day reporting. Absolute sobriety from controlled substances. No controlled substances w/o a valid prescription and only in amount prescribed.
